author: Kiriakos [SPEC]
title: NFT re-minting service
description: All NFTs are currently created as a custom asset with 1 coin. This dissuades partial ownership and introduces reminting policy problems

assessments.note: While this proposal would improve the Cardano ecosystem as a whole, I fail to see how it directly relates to the experience of developers on Cardano. If it were to be resubmitted in the future I would suggest probably placing it in a different category.

The NFT minting has so far been the user-oriented process in an ad-hoc manner leading to many policy errors. The proposal aims to develop a reminting service and also a platform for multi-owner NFTs. With the demand for NFTs growing this kind of service is required to create competition and further innovation.

I would suggest including a clearer background for the proposer in a future version of the proposal with links to previous works. Being a member of the Plutus Pioneers program would certainly help the proposer stand out if proof of this would have been provided. Phase 1 is mentioned in the budget breakdown, but a clear roadmap isn't provided of all the phases envisioned and how they would play out. The budget is pretty clear and the implementation seems relatively straight forward.

The proposer is operating Spectrum Cardano stake pool. Spectrum pool is a Mission Oriented pool that donates to some cause. The proposer however has not presented capability in software development capability.
Project seems feasible. Its not clear it meets the challenge of "helps the developer focus on building successful apps".

The proposal lacks an estimated implementation date for the project or an expected delivery date. Phase 1 is mentioned but it isn't indicated what the deliverables of this Phase 1 would be. The proposal lacks a clear roadmap, and an outline of any sort of what the next phases would consist of. No assessment of risks is made. I would suggest including all these elements in a future version of the proposal.

The process is presented in phases and involves the development of software. There is a need to open source the project, which is assumed for all Catalyst-funded projects. With this backdrop, the project can be audited and monitored.

solution: Create a standardized NFT re-minter that can fix policy errors, create partially owned NFTs and trace NFT heritage
experience:
Decades of software development experience creating web scale applications and running them.

6+ years of blockchain ops.
